intro: Pulsatilla balcana, commonly known as the Balkan pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. It has palmate leaves with a hairy texture and produces follicles that contain its seeds. Pulsatilla balcana is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
